data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Default_Roles_Lbl
data.value: Add new user accounts to these roles:

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_RedirectAfterLogin_Lbl
data.value: Always redirect to user's album after logging on

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_RequireEmailValidation_Lbl
data.value: Require e-mail validation to activate account

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_UseEmailForAccountName_Lbl
data.value: Use e-mail address for user name

data.name: Cfg_enableSelfRegistration_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether anonymous users are allowed to create accounts. If user albums are enabled, an album is created for each user.

data.name: Cfg_enableUserAlbum_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether each user is assigned ownership of an album created solely for that user.

The album is automatically created when the user first logs on and the option \\'Automatically create user album the first time a user logs on to the gallery\\' is enabled. The permissions assigned to the user for this album are copied from the template role _Album Owner Template. You can change the permissions in this role to control the default security access given to each user.

Disabling this option does not delete the user albums.

data.name: Cfg_redirectToUserAlbumAfterLogin_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether to redirect the user to his or her album after logging in. If disabled, the current page is re-loaded or, if there isn\\'t a page, the user is shown the top level album for which the user has view access.

data.name: Cfg_redirectToUserAlbumAfterLogin_Hdr
data.value: Redirect to user album after logging in

data.name: Cfg_requireEmailValidationForSelfRegisteredUser_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether e-mail verification is required when a user registers an account. When selected, the account is initially disabled and an e-mail is sent to the user with a verification link. When the user clicks the link, the user is approved.

If the option to require administrator approval for new accounts is enabled, then the user is not approved until an administrator activates the account.

Enabling this setting reduces spam activity and guarantees that a valid e-mail address is associated with the user.

When disabled, an e-mail address is not required and the user account is immediately created.

data.name: Cfg_useEmailForAccountName_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether account names are always e-mail addresses. When disabled, the self registration wizard includes fields for both an account name and an e-mail address, but when enabled it requests only an e-mail address.

data.name: Cfg_userAlbumNameTemplate_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the template to use for naming the album that is created for new users. The placeholder string {UserName}, if present, is replaced by the user\\'s account name.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_ShowOwnerRoles_Bdy
data.value:
The album owner and user album features use roles behind the scenes to manage the security access to the albums. These roles are automatically created when needed and always begin with the text Album Owner.

Typically an administrator does not interact with these roles, so they are hidden by default. Check this option to view them.

You may delete an owner role if it is no longer associated with an album or user. If you accidentally delete a role associated with a user album, it will be automatically recreated the next time the user logs on.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_Show_Owner_Roles_Lbl
data.value: Show roles that support the album ownership and user album features

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Show_Album_Owner_Roles_Lbl
data.value: Show roles that support the album ownership and user album features

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_RequireAdminApproval_Lbl
data.value: Require administrator approval to activate account

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Show_Album_Owner_Roles_Lbl
data.value: Show roles that support the album ownership and user album features

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Users_To_Notify_For_New_Accounts_Lbl
data.value: Send an e-mail to the following users when an account is created:

data.name: Cfg_defaultRolesForSelfRegisteredUser_Bdy
data.value:
Visitors who register their own accounts can optionally be added to one or more roles when the account is created. For example, you might add them to a role that removes the watermark, gives them read-only access to the entire site, or permission to upload items to a particular album.

This setting applies ONLY to self-registered users. That is, when an administrator manually creates an account, these roles are not assigned to the user.

Note: If user albums are enabled, the user is automatically given full permission to his or her personal album, even if no roles are specified here.

data.name: Cfg_requireApprovalForSelfRegisteredUser_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether an administrator must approve newly created accounts before the user can log on. When enabled, the account is disabled until it is approved by an administrator. (An administrator is a user belonging to a role with AllowAdministerSite permission.)

To receive an e-mail notification when a user creates an account, include your account in the new account notification setting in the User Accounts section. Note that when e-mail verification is enabled, the e-mail notification is not sent until the user validates the e-mail address.

data.name: Cfg_userAlbumParentAlbumId_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies the album in which user albums are created.

If a different album is selected, existing user albums are not automatically moved. To move them to another album, use the standard functionality for moving albums.

data.name: Cfg_usersToNotifyWhenAccountIsCreated_Bdy
data.value:
Users specified here receive an e-mail notification when an account is created. This applies to both administrator-created or self-registered accounts.

To receive an e-mail, each user must have a valid e-mail address and e-mail functionality must be configured.

If self-registration is enabled with the e-mail validation option selected, the e-mail is not sent until the new account holder validates the account from the verification e-mail.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Invalid_Role_Name_Msg
data.value: The role {0} does not represent an existing role.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Invalid_User_Name_Msg
data.value: The user '{0}' does not represent an existing user.

data.name: CreateAccount_Success_Pending_Approval_Detail2_Text
data.value: It is now waiting for administrator approval. If you provided an e-mail address, you will be notified when it is activated.

data.name: CreateAccount_Verification_Success_Needs_Admin_Approval_Detail_Text
data.value: Congratulations! Your account has been validated and is now waiting for administrator approval. When it is approved, an e-mail will be sent to you and you will be able to log on.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Invalid_UserAlbumParent_Msg
data.value: Select an album to contain the user albums.

data.name: Admin_Images_DiscardOriginal_Label
data.value: Discard the original image when it is added to the gallery

data.name: Cfg_discardOriginalImageDuringImport_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether to discard the original image when it is added to the gallery. This option, when enabled, helps reduce disk space usage.

This option applies only to images, and only when they are added through an upload or by synchronizing. Changing this setting does not affect existing media objects.

When unchecked, users still have the option to discard the original image on the Add Objects page by unchecking the corresponding checkbox.

data.name: Admin_MediaObjects_Cannot_Set_MO_Path_Read_Only_Cache_Location_Not_Set
data.value: Invalid configuration. A read-only gallery requires that the thumbnail and optimized file paths be different than the original media objects path. mediaObjectPath={0}; thumbnailPath={1}; optimizedPath={2}
data.comment: <2009.05.13> The error message shown when the user attempts to set the media object path as read only but the thumbnail and optimized paths are the same as the media object path.

data.name: Admin_MediaObjects_Cannot_Set_MO_Path_Read_Only_Synch_Title_And_Directory_Enabled
data.value: Invalid configuration. A read-only gallery requires that the automatic renaming of directory names be disabled. Uncheck the option Synchronize directory names with album titles.
data.comment: <2009.05.13> The error message shown when the user attempts to set the media object path as read only but the option to synchronize album titles and directory names is enabled.

data.name: Admin_MediaObjects_Cannot_Set_MO_Path_Read_Only_User_Albums_Enabled
data.value: Invalid configuration. A read-only gallery requires that user albums be disabled. User albums can be disabled on the User Settings page.
data.comment: <2009.05.13> The error message shown when the user attempts to set the media object path as read only but user albums are enabled.

data.name: Error_User_Album_Parent_Invalid_Ex_Msg
data.value: User Album Parent Invalid: The gallery '{0}' has an album ID specified ({1}) as the user album container that does not match an existing album. Review this setting in the administration area.

data.name: Task_Delete_Album_Cannot_Delete_Contains_User_Album_Parent_Ex_Msg
data.value: The album {0} cannot be deleted because it contains the user albums. If you want to delete this album, you must first disable the user album feature or configure another album to be the user album container.

data.name: MyAccount_Email_Address_Bdy
data.value: Enter your e-mail address. Certain functions, such as the password recovery feature, require a valid e-mail address.

data.name: MyAccount_EnableUserAlbum_Bdy
data.value:
Enable or disable your own personal album with this option.

When checked, an album is automatically created for your account. Typically this is an album you have administrative rights to, allowing you to upload files, edit existing objects, and delete items. Once created, you can view your album by clicking the link in the top right corner.

If you do not want a personal album, you can delete it by unchecking this option.

WARNING: Disabling your user album causes your album, including all media objects in them, to be permanently deleted! This action cannot be undone.

data.name: MyAccount_EnableUserAlbum_Warning
data.value: Warning: Unchecking this option will delete all items in your album. This action cannot be undone.

data.name: Site_Missing_Data_Text
data.comment: <2009.05.13> The string to use when text is missing. Currently, this is used in place of the logged on user name for the LastModifiedByUserName and CreatedByUserName audit fields in the album class when an object is created/modified by an anonymous user.

data.name: MyAccount_Delete_Account_Confirmation
data.value: When you delete your account, you are immediately logged off and your account is deleted. This action cannot be reversed. Are you sure you want to delete your account?

data.name: MyAccount_Delete_Account_Err_Msg
data.value: An error occurred while deleting this account and has been recorded in the error log (error ID {0}: {1}).
data.comment: <2009.05.13> The message that is shown if an error occurs when the user attempts to delete his or her own account on the my account page. The first placeholder is for the error ID; the second is for the exception type.

data.name: MyAccount_Delete_Account_Overview
data.value: Click the link below to permanently delete your account.

data.name: MyAccount_Delete_Account_Warning
data.value: ATTENTION: This removes all personally identifiable information from the system. This action cannot be reversed.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_AllowCopyingReadOnlyObjects_Label
data.value: Allow a user to copy objects that are read-only

data.name: Cfg_allowCopyingReadOnlyObjects_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether to allow the copying of objects a user has only view permissions for. In a community gallery scenario, disabling this option can help prevent users from copying other users\\' items.

When disabled, a user must be able to write to an album in order to copy objects from it. When enabled, a user can copy objects from any album for which they have view permission.

data.name: Cfg_userAlbumSummaryTemplate_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the template to use for the album summary of a newly created user album.

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_DataProvider_GalleryData_Popup_Bdy
data.value:
This gallery data provider manages the gallery data such as titles, summaries, metadata, error logs, and configuration settings.

The applicationName attribute in the galleryServerPro section of web.config defines the application name. This value can be any string and is not used by Gallery Server Pro.

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_DataProvider_Membership_Popup_Bdy
data.value:
The membership data provider manages the user accounts.

The applicationName attribute in the membership section of web.config defines the application name. In most cases, this value should match the application name for the roles and profile providers.

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_DataProvider_Popup_Bdy
data.value:
Gallery Server Pro uses the .NET concept of data providers for data storage. A data provider is some self-contained code, usually in a separate dll, that knows how to store and retrieve data to and from a particular data storage device such as SQL Server, SQL CE, a text file, etc.

There are four types of data used in Gallery Server Pro, and each is associated with a particular data provider:

  • Membership (users)
  • Roles
  • Profiles (user-specific settings)
  • Gallery Data

The data providers are specified in the web.config configuration file. In most cases the Install Wizard sets these up for you, but in some cases you may want to manually configure them, such as when you are integrating Gallery Server Pro into an existing web site or you are configuring a new data provider such as Active Directory.

Refer to the Administrator\\'s Guide for more information about configuring data providers or creating your own.

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_DataProvider_Role_Popup_Bdy
data.value:
The role data provider manages the roles each user belongs to.

The applicationName attribute in the roleManager section of web.config defines the application name. In most cases, this value should match the application name for the membership and profile providers.

data.name: MyAccount_Delete_Account_With_User_Albums_Warning
data.value: ATTENTION: This removes all personally identifiable information from the system, including the contents of your user album. This action cannot be reversed.

data.name: UC_ActionMenu_Download_Objects_Tooltip
data.value: Download one or more objects from the current album

data.name: Task_Add_Objects_External_Tab_Invalid_Html_Msg
data.value: The HTML you entered contains text that is not allowed under the current security settings. If you are an administrator, they can be enabled on the User Settings page in the Site Admin area. Invalid HTML tags: {0}; Invalid HTML attributes: {1}; Invalid javascript detected: {2}

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_AllowJavascript_Label
data.value: Allow users to enter javascript in titles, captions, and external media objects (not recommended)

data.name: Cfg_allowDeleteOwnAccount_Bdy
data.value:
When enabled, an option is made available on each user\\'s My account page to delete the account. This setting is typically enabled in community gallery scenarios where users are creating their own accounts.

Warning: If user albums are enabled and a user deletes their account, the contents of the user\\'s personal album are also deleted.

data.name: Cfg_allowedHtmlAttributes_Bdy
data.value:
This is a comma separated list of HTML attributes that are accepted as user input when the HTML option is enabled. If an attribute is in this list, a user may include it in album titles and summaries, media object titles, and external media object HTML snippets.

Note that when an attribute is allowed, the value of the attribute is also allowed. The only filtering that takes place on an attribute value is the removal of the string "javascript:" when the javascript option is disabled.

data.name: Cfg_allowedHtmlTags_Bdy
data.value:
This is a comma separated list of HTML tags that are accepted as user input when the HTML option is enabled. If a tag is in this list, a user may include it in album titles and summaries, media object titles, and external media object HTML snippets.

For best performance, put the most commonly used HTML tags first.

data.name: Cfg_allowUserEnteredJavascript_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether javascript is allowed in user input. When enabled, a user may include script HTML blocks and the string "javascript:" in HTML attributes. When disabled, all script HTML blocks and the string "javascript:" is removed from user input.

Note: To use script HTML blocks, you must also enable HTML content and specify the script HTML tag as an allowed tag.

WARNING: It is recommended you leave this option disabled, as turning it on increases the risk of a cross-site scripting attack and other malicious attacks.

There may be times when enabling javascript may be useful. For example, some web sites use script tags in their embed code, so the only way to create a media object with their embed code is to have javascript enabled. One option for dealing with this is to temporarily enable javascript long enough to configure the media objects with the desired javascript. Since disabling this option does not remove existing javascript, this technique preserves the javascript in those objects while preventing users from adding any new javascript.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_AllowManageAccount_Lbl
data.value: Allow a user to manage their account

data.name: Cfg_allowManageOwnAccount_Bdy
data.value:
When enabled, a link to the user\\'s account page appears at the top right of every page. This page allows a user to change their password, update their e-mail address, enter a description, disable their personal user album (if user albums are enabled), and delete their account.

Disable this option to prevent a user from making these changes.

An administrator can always change these settings, even when this setting is disabled, through the Manage Users page in the Site admin area.

data.name: Site_No
data.comment: <2009.06.18> See description for the Site_Yes resource.

data.name: Site_Yes
data.comment: <2009.06.18> The word to use that is the equivalent of YES in English. Used for the Yes/No radio buttons on the Edit User dialog of the Manage Users page. May be used in other places in the future.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Delete_Orphan_User_Albums_Confirm_Msg
data.value: You are about to delete the selected albums. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure?

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Orphan_User_Albums_One_Lbl

data.name: Site_Gallery_Text
data.comment: <2010.10.12> The text that is used anywhere we want to use the concept of a gallery.

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Settings_Test_Email_Invalid_Text
data.value: The user '{0}' either does not have an e-mail address associated with the account or it is not a valid e-mail address.

data.value: The user '{0}' does not have a valid e-mail address.

data.name: Admin_General_Invalid_User_Name_Msg
data.value: The user '{0}' does not represent an existing user.

data.name: Admin_General_Show_All_Users_Lbl
data.value: Show all users, not just administrators

data.name: Admin_MediaObjects_MO_Path_Used_By_Another_Gallery
data.value: Invalid configuration. The path '{0}' is being used by another gallery you do not have permission to administer. Specify a different path.
data.comment: <2010.10.12> The error message shown when a user attempts to specify a media object, thumbnail, or optimized path that is being used by another gallery, and the user is not a gallery admin for that gallery or a site admin.

data.name: Cfg_enableCache_Bdy
data.value:
When enabled, caching is used to reduce the need to query information from the database, substantially improving performance.

Caching may need to be disabled when this application is deployed on a web farm. The reason is because caching is local to the server, which can result in - for example - a user adding media objects to one server, then being redirected to another server that is not yet aware of the new items, potentially causing an error.

data.name: Cfg_enableMetadata_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether users can view the metadata extracted from files. When enabled, a toolbar button appears above the media object that triggers a popup panel with the information.

Disabling this option causes the toolbar icon to be hidden, even if metadata has previously been extracted.

data.name: Admin_VidAudOther_Validation_VideoThumbnailPosition_Text
data.value: Must be an integer between 0 and 86,400

data.name: Cfg_VideoThumbnailPosition_Bdy
data.value:
The position, in seconds, in the video where the thumbnail image is generated from. A value of three indicates the thumbnail for the video is generated from a frame three seconds from the beginning of the video. The value must be between 0 and 86,400 seconds.

If a video is shorter than the value specified here, an image from the beginning of the video is used.

This feature requires the FFmpeg.exe utility be installed in the bin directory and that the application is running in Full Trust. A default thumbnail will be substituted if these requirements are not met or the FFmpeg utility is unable to generate a thumbnail image.

The FFmpeg utility is included in the free Gallery Server Pro Binary Pack, available for download from the website.

data.name: Cfg_MediaContainerDimensions_Bdy
data.value:
These settings specify the dimensions that are applied to the HTML DOM element that contains video or audio. When a media file is added to the gallery, these values are assigned to the width and height properties of the media object. They are then used to populate the {Width} and {Height} replacement parameters in the HTML browser template.

If the browser template does not use the {Width} and {Height} replacement parameters, these settings have no effect.

After changing this value, perform a synchronization to update existing media objects with the new values.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_AdminGallery_Bdy
data.value:
This permission provides unrestricted access to one or more galleries. This includes adding and editing albums and media objects, and configuring gallery settings. It also includes managing users and roles when the site administrator has enabled this option (Site Settings - General page).

This permission applies to an entire gallery and cannot be selectively applied to individual albums.

DotNetNuke only: A user must also be a member of the Administrators role in order to manage users and roles.

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Control_Settings_AutoPlaySlideShow_Label
data.value: Automatically start slide show when page loads

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Control_Settings_ShowMediaObjectIndexPosition_Label
data.value: Show the media object's index position (e.g. "(3 of 24)")

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Control_Settings_ShowMediaObjectNavigation_Label
data.value: Show next/previous buttons for media objects

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Control_Settings_ShowMediaObjectToolbar_Label
data.value: Show toolbar above the media object

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Control_Settings_TreeviewNavUrl_Label
data.value: Page to go to when album node is clicked:

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Settings_Gallery_Description_Required
data.value: Enter a name for the gallery.

data.value: The gallery has been successfully created.

data.value: All galleries you have permission to administer

data.comment: <2010.10.12> The text to use when displaying a gallery's description. Ex: "Gallery 'My Gallery'" The first placeholder is replaced by a link to the gallery; the second is replaced by the gallery's description.

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Settings_Cannot_Display_Account_Edit_Link_Msg
data.value: Warning: When the header is hidden, Gallery Server Pro cannot display the link to allow users to manage their own account. To keep the link visible, enable the header and turn off individual header controls to achieve the desired effect.

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Control_Settings_ShowAlbumTreeViewForAlbum_Label
data.value: Show an album treeview along left side when an album is being shown

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Control_Description_Label
data.value: The Gallery user control '{0}' on page '{1}'

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Settings_Change_Gallery_Tooltip
data.value: Associate the selected gallery with this web page

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Control_Settings_ShowAlbumTreeViewForMediaObject_Label
data.value: Show an album treeview along left side when a single media object is being shown

data.name: Admin_Cannot_Delete_Role_Insufficient_Permission_Msg
data.value: The role '{0}' has access to a gallery (Gallery '{1}') that you are not an administrator for. To delete a role, one of the following must be true: (1) you are a site administrator, or (2) you are a gallery administrator in every gallery the role has access to.

data.name: Admin_Cannot_Delete_Role_Remove_Self_Admin_Msg
data.value: You are attempting to delete a role that would remove or restrict your level of administrative access. If you really want to do this, log on as another user and make the changes from that account.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_Cannot_Delete_Role_Insufficient_Permission_Msg
data.value: You must be a site administrator to save changes to a role with Administer site permission. Sadly, you are just a gallery administrator.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_Cannot_Delete_Role_Insufficient_Permission_Msg2
data.value: You are attempting to save changes to a role that applies to multiple galleries, including at least one gallery you do not have permission to administer. To edit this role, you must be one of the following : (1) a site administrator, or (2) a gallery administrator in every gallery this role applies to.

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Settings_CurrentGallery_Info_Bdy
data.value:
Here you can change the gallery the current instance of Gallery Server Pro points to.

A gallery has these charecteristics:

  • Contains a collection of albums and media objects that are stored at a particular file path
  • Has a distinct set of settings, such as watermark, image size, user settings, etc.
  • Can be managed by a gallery or site administrator

By default, each web application has one gallery. This is sufficient for many users, but there are situations where it can be useful to have more than one gallery:

  • You want to have one gallery for staging and another for production.
  • You have departments in your company that should each have their own gallery.
  • You have media files in multiple locations you want to expose, such as D:\\\\Pictures and D:\\\\Video.
  • You want to set up a gallery for each member of your family.
  • You want some images to be 640x480 and others to be smaller (or larger).
  • You require different watermarks to be applied to different sets of images.
  • You want to provide a user with different gallery-wide permissions. For example, perhaps you want user Bob to be a gallery administrator for one set of objects but have edit-only permission for another set.
  • You want to allow some users to upload any file type of any size, but others should only be able to upload .JPEG files that are less than 5 MB.

Note that if all you want to do is hide albums from certain users, you can use roles and an album\\'s privacy setting rather than creating a new gallery.

Viewing multiple galleries

Each instance of the Gallery Server Pro control is associated with a single gallery. To view multiple galleries, you must create additional web pages and point those instances of Gallery Server Pro to the new gallery. One easy way to do this is to copy the web page containing this control, give it a new name, then load the page in a web browser and point it to the new gallery with this page.

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Settings_ManageGalleries_Info_Bdy
data.value:
Add, edit or delete galleries for the current web application. The table displays only those galleries where the currently logged on user is a gallery administrator.

You can view the contents of the current gallery with the View link. To view other galleries, first switch to that gallery in the Current Gallery section.

Clicking the Edit link allows you to change the name of the gallery. To modify other settings, such as the media files path, use the appropriate administration page.

Deleting a gallery will delete all albums, media objects, and other records associated with the gallery. As a safety precaution, the media files are NOT deleted - only the records in the database are deleted. You may delete the media files manually using a tool like Windows Explorer.

The Create gallery link creates a new gallery, including a default set of gallery settings. After creating a gallery, one of the first things you should do is update the media files path on the Media Objects - General page.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_AllowAnonBrowsing_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether users can browse the gallery without logging in. When unchecked, users must log in with a valid account to view media objects.

Remember that this setting applies only to the instance of Gallery Server Pro on this web page. If an administrator created other web pages with a gallery, this setting does not apply to them.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_AllowUrlOverride_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether an album or media object specified in the URL can override the default gallery object specified above. Since this is the means by which most album and media object navigation occurs in Gallery Server Pro, disabling this option prevents the user from viewing any album or media object other than the one specified as the default gallery object.

When unchecked, hyperlinks are not rendered on thumbnail images or the album breadcrumb menu.

Another way to prevent users from viewing albums or media objects is to set an album as private (for anonymous users) or use role permissions (for logged on users).

NOTE: This setting DOES NOT affect the ability of a user to click the Next / Previous buttons that appear above a single media object. To disable this type of navigation, disable the option below called Show media object navigation buttons.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_AutoPlaySlideshow_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether a slide show of media objects automatically starts playing when the page loads.

This setting applies only when the View Mode is set to \\'Show a single media object\\'. If the Default Gallery Object has been set to a single media object, then a slideshow starting with that image will begin when the page loads.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_DefaultGalleryObject_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies which gallery object to display when an object is not specifically requested. That is, loading the web page without any query string parameters will cause the gallery object specified here to be displayed.

You can select the current gallery, which will show the root level album, or you can choose a specific album or media object.

Users are never shown objects they do not have permission to view. When the default gallery object is set to the current gallery, the user is shown the highest album he or she has permission to view. If an album or media object option is specified and the user does not have permission to view it, a message appears telling the user they have insufficient permission.

NOTE: When the Allow URL navigation option is enabled, users can navigate to other albums and media objects by specifying an album or media object ID in the query string.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_GalleryTitleUrl_Bdy
data.value:
The URL the user will be directed to when she clicks the gallery\\'s title text. It is optional: if not present, no link will be rendered.

Examples:

  • http://www.mysite.com
  • / (the root of the web site)
  • ~/ (the top level album)

data.name: Cfg_GCS_GalleryTitle_Bdy
data.value: The header text that appears at the top of every gallery.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_OverrideSettings_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether to override the gallery settings for this instance of the Gallery Server Pro control on the current web page.

When disabled, the behavior of the gallery is controlled by settings on the other administration pages. When enabled, those settings are overridden by the specific values set here.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_Overview_Bdy
data.value:
By default, the settings for this instance of the Gallery Server Pro control on the current web page are inherited from the gallery-level settings specified on the other pages in the Site admin area. Since an administrator can display a gallery on more than one page, it is sometimes useful to be able to specify settings at the control level rather than the gallery level.

For example, a developer might place an instance of Gallery Server Pro on the home page and use the settings here to display a slide show of a particular album. A separate web page might contain the user control with default settings to allow for easy management.

IMPORTANT: Remember that the settings on this page override the settings on other pages. It is also important to understand that the settings affect this control instance, regardless of which gallery is being displayed. If you switch to another gallery on the Gallery Manager page, these settings will remain the same while the other pages will reflect the settings for the new gallery. (One exception to this rule is that if an album or media object is specified as the default gallery object, it is cleared after switching galleries, since the previous value is no longer valid.)

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowActionMenu_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether to show the Actions menu for logged on users.

NOTE: Regardless of this setting, the Actions menu is always HIDDEN for anonymous users and for logged-on users who do not have permission to carry out any task. The Actions menu is always VISIBLE for gallery and site administrators, even when this setting is disabled (this helps you get back to the admin area to adjust settings).

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowAlbumBreadcrumb_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether to show the album bread crumb links.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowAlbumTreeViewForAlbum_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether to render a treeview of albums along the left side when an album is being displayed.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowAlbumTreeViewForMediaObject_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether to render a treeview of albums along the left side when a single media object is being displayed.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowCopyButton_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether the copy media object button is visible above a media object. The button is not shown if the current user does not have permission to copy media objects, even if this property is enabled.

This setting has no effect when the media object toolbar is hidden.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowDeleteButton_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether the delete media object button is visible above a media object. The button is not shown if the current user does not have permission to delete media objects, even if this property is enabled.

This setting has no effect when the media object toolbar is hidden.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowDownloadButton_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether the download media object button is visible above a media object.

This setting has no effect when the media object toolbar is hidden.

Note that disabling this setting is not 100% effective in preventing a user from downloading a media object, since a user already has access if he or she can view it in the browser. The only effective method for ensuring users cannot download your media files is to use DRM protection, which is a feature that Gallery Server Pro does not provide.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowDownloadZipButton_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether the download ZIP archive button is visible above a media object.

This setting has no effect when the media object toolbar is hidden.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowHeader_Bdy
data.value: When checked, the header area of the gallery is displayed. The header includes the gallery title and various links at the top right (login/logout, search, edit account, and user album home page links).

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowHighResButton_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether the show high resolution image button is visible above a media object. If the current user is not allowed to view the high-res image or the image does not have a high-resolution version, the button is not shown, even if this setting is enabled.

This setting has no effect when the media object toolbar is hidden.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowLogin_Bdy
data.value:
When checked, login and logout controls are displayed in the top right corner of every page. You may want to disable this feature when the audience is primarily anonymous web users without user accounts.

Administrators can always log in by navigating directly to the login page (use the query string g=login; ex: default.aspx?g=login).

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowMediaObjectIndexPosition_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether to display the relative position of a media object within an album (example: (3 of 24)). This text is shown only when a single media object is being displayed.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowMediaObjectNavigation_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether the next and previous buttons are rendered for individual media objects. Disabling this option also disables the ability to navigate using the left and right arrow keys.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowMediaObjectTitle_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether the title is displayed beneath individual media objects.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowMediaObjectToolbar_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether the toolbar is rendered above individual media objects.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowMetadataButton_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether the show metadata button is visible above a media object.

This setting has no effect when the media object toolbar is hidden.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowMoveButton_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether the transfer media object button is visible above a media object. The button is not shown if the current user does not have permission to move media objects, even if this property is enabled.

This setting has no effect when the media object toolbar is hidden.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowPermalinkButton_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether Gallery Server Pro offers users a permalink and embed code for a media object. When enabled, a toolbar button appears above the media object that, when clicked, shows this information. The hyperlink links directly to the media object and is a convenient way to share links with others.

The embed code can be pasted into other websites, allowing those websites to display media objects from the gallery.

This setting has no effect when the media object toolbar is hidden.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowRotateButton_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether the rotate media object button is visible above a media object. The button is not shown if the current user does not have permission to rotate media objects, even if this property is enabled.

This setting has no effect when the media object toolbar is hidden.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowSearch_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether to display the search link in the top right corner of every page.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ShowSlideShowButton_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether the play/pause slide show button is visible above a media object.

This setting has no effect when the media object toolbar is hidden.

data.name: Cfg_GCS_ViewMode_Bdy
data.value:
The view mode specifies how albums and media objects are displayed.

Album - A single album is shown, with the contents displayed as a set of thumbnail images.

Media object - A single media object is shown. If the URL specifies an album, then the first media object in the album is displayed.

Treeview - The gallery is rendered as a treeview of albums. You can optionally specify an URL to navigate to when an album node is clicked. The ID of the clicked album is automatically included in the URL\\'s query string. This can be useful for displaying a treeview that acts as a menu to take users to another page containing a gallery control.

data.name: Cfg_showHeader_Bdy
data.value:
When checked, the header area of the gallery is displayed. The header includes the gallery title and various links at the top right (login/logout, search, edit account, and user album home page links).

This setting can be overridden on the Gallery Control Settings page.

data.name: Task_Delete_Album_Cannot_Delete_Contains_Default_Gallery_Object_Ex_Msg
data.value: The album {0} cannot be deleted because it is or it contains the default gallery object in the gallery. If you want to delete this album, you must first change the default gallery object. You can do this on the Gallery Control Settings page in the Site admin area.

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Control_Settings_Invalid_MediaObject_Msg
data.value: Error: The media object specified for the default gallery object (ID# {0}) does not exist.

data.name: Msg_AlbumNotAuthorizedForUser_Dtl
data.value: You are are not authorized to view the requested album. Contact your administrator to request access.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_Cannot_Save_Role_User_Would_Lose_Admin_Ability_Msg
data.value: Cannot remove requested roles. You are editing a role you are a member of, and you are attempting to remove your ability to administer this gallery. If you really want to do this, log on as another user and make the changes from that account, or make yourself a member of another role with administrative permission before modifying this role.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_EnableUserAlbumDefaultForUser_Lbl
data.value: Automatically create user album the first time a user logs on to the gallery

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Turn_Off_User_Album_Lbl_Bdy
data.value:
This action updates the profiles for existing user accounts in the current gallery. Specifically, it sets the EnableUserAlbum profile setting to False for all users.

If a user album exists for an account, it will be automatically deleted the next time he or she logs in.

WARNING: Clicking this button will cause the permanent deletion of user albums for all accounts in this gallery!

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Turn_Off_User_Album_Lbl_Text
data.value: Turn off user albums for all existing accounts

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Turn_On_User_Album_Lbl_Bdy
data.value:
This action updates the profiles for existing user accounts in the current gallery. Specifically, it sets the EnableUserAlbum profile setting to True for all users.

This will cause a user album to be created for a user the next time he or she logs in if it does not already exist.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Turn_On_User_Album_Lbl_Text
data.value: Turn on user albums for all existing accounts

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_User_Album_Existing_Accounts_Lbl_Bdy
data.value:
In addition to enabling or disabling user albums at the gallery level, an individual user account can have its user album enabled or disabled. This allows some users to have a user album while others do not. The default value of this setting for new user accounts is assigned in the New user accounts section above.

In some cases an administrator may want to change this profile setting for existing users.

For example, you may decide to enable user albums at a time when many users - and their profile records - already exist, but the profile setting does not have the desired value. (Maybe you want each user\\'s album disabled by default but the profile records were created with the EnableUserAlbum setting set to true.) Click one of the buttons below to update the EnableUserAlbum profile setting to either true (enabled) or false (disabled) for all existing accounts.

IMPORTANT: Clicking either of the buttons below will not immediately create or delete any user albums, but the next time each user logs on, the validation logic will create or delete the user\\'s album based on the value of their profile setting. When the user\\'s profile specifies a disabled user album and a user album currently exists, the album - and its contents - are permanently deleted. Use with caution!

Note: To improve performance, user profiles are stored in the server\\'s session, which means currently logged on users will not see the effect of you enabling or disabling profiles until the next time their profile is retrieved from the data store. To force your change to take immediate effect, restart the application.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_User_Album_Existing_Accounts_Lbl_Hdr
data.value: Change user album setting in existing accounts

data.name: Cfg_enableUserAlbumDefaultForUser_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether a user album is automatically created the first time a user logs on.

Specifically, this setting defines the default value of the EnableUserAlbum setting in the user\\'s profile record.

A user can enable or disable his or her user album on the account settings page. An administrator can access this setting for any user on the Manage Users page.

Note that if you have turned off the option to allow a user to manage their account (see below), then only an administrator can enable or disable a user\\'s album.

This setting applies only when user albums are enabled.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Cannot_Enable_User_Albums_In_Read_Only_Gallery
data.value: Cannot enable user albums in a read-only gallery.

data.name: Admin_Backup_Restore_Db_Successfully_Restored_AppNotRecycled_Msg

data.name: Installer_Finished_CouldNotRestartApp_Msg
data.value: Attention - Cannot automatically restart: The wizard could not automatically restart the application. In most cases this is not required, but if you get an error or notice you cannot log on, try restarting the IIS application pool identity or make a trivial update to the web.config file.

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_AllowGalleryAdminToManageUsersAndRoles_Label
data.value: Allow gallery admins to manage users and roles

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_AllowGalleryAdminToViewAllUsersAndRoles_Label
data.value: Allow gallery admins to view users/roles who do not have access to current gallery

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Cannot_Enable_Self_Registration_Msg
data.value: Cannot enable self-registration. The site administrator has disabled the ability for a gallery administrator to manage users and roles.

data.name: Cfg_allowGalleryAdminToManageUsersAndRole_Bdy
data.value:
When enabled, gallery administrators are allowed to create, edit, and delete users and roles. When disabled, gallery admins cannot access the Manage Users and Manage Roles pages, nor can they enable the self registration feature.

This setting affects only gallery administrators - site administrators and regular users are unaffected.

DotNetNuke only: A user must also be a member of the Administrators role in order to manage users and roles.

data.name: Cfg_allowGalleryAdminToManageUsersAndRole_Hdr
data.value: Allow gallery admins to manage users and roles

data.name: Cfg_allowGalleryAdminViewAllUsersAndRoles_Bdy
data.value:
When enabled, gallery administrators are allowed to view users and roles who do not have access to current gallery. This option affects any area where users and roles are displayed, such as the Manage Users, Manage Roles and User Settings pages and the list of users in the album owner dropdown list.

This option must be enabled for a gallery administrator to be able to give existing users access to a gallery.

Note that even when this setting is enabled, a gallery administrator cannot perform any task that would violate the security scope. For example, a gallery administrator for gallery A cannot give a user access to gallery B unless the admin is also an administrator for gallery B, regardless of this setting.

This setting affects only gallery administrators - site administrators and regular users are unaffected.

data.name: Cfg_allowGalleryAdminViewAllUsersAndRoles_Hdr
data.value: Allow gallery admins to view all users and roles

data.name: Cfg_enableAlbumZipDownload_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether users can download entire albums in a ZIP archive. When an album is selected, any child albums it contains are also included. This can require a great deal of processing power if the user has selected a top-level album that contains many child objects.

Disable this option to reduce the impact a user can have on server performance.

When disabled, only media objects in the current album can be downloaded.

data.name: Admin_Albums_AutoSyncIntervalMinutes_Lbl
data.value: Check for new files every {blank} minutes
data.comment: <2011.02.21> Used in error message when an invalid value is entered

data.name: Admin_Albums_AutoSyncIntervalMinutes_Lbl1
data.comment: <2011.02.21> A textbox is placed between this text and the text in Admin_Albums_AutoSyncIntervalMinutes_Lbl2

data.name: Admin_Albums_AutoSyncIntervalMinutes_Lbl2
data.comment: <2011.02.21> A textbox is placed between this text and the text in Admin_Albums_AutoSyncIntervalMinutes_Lbl1

data.name: Admin_Albums_EnableAutoSync_Lbl
data.value: Automatically synchronize gallery with media objects directory

data.name: Admin_Albums_EnableRemoteSync_Lbl
data.value: Allow external applications to synchronize gallery

data.name: Admin_Albums_RemoteAccess_Msg
data.value: Turning on this feature enables the following web service methods:

data.name: Cfg_autoSyncIntervalMinutes_Bdy
data.value:
The interval, in minutes, between synchronizations.

Note: This feature depends on periodic browser requests. If the site is infrequently accessed, the intervals between synchronizations may be longer than the value specified here.

data.name: Cfg_enableAutoSync_Bdy
data.value: Indicates whether to periodically synchronize the current gallery at a user-specified interval.

data.name: Cfg_enableRemoteSync_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether external applications are allowed to initiate synchronizations through web service methods. When enabled, several web service methods can be invoked by any client that includes the specified password.

The protocols used to invoke the methods (GET, POST, SOAP, etc.) are defined in the application\\'s configuration file. Refer to Microsoft\\'s documentation on web services for details.

data.name: Cfg_remoteAccessPassword_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the password to use when invoking the web service methods. This is required to help ensure that only authorized users are able to invoke the methods.

data.name: Admin_Albums_LastAutoSync_Never_Lbl
data.comment: <2011.02.21> Text to display when an auto-sync has never been performed

data.name: Task_Delete_Album_DeleteDbRecordsOnly_Bdy
data.value:
When selected, the directory associated with this album and the media files it contains are preserved; only the database records and the thumbnail/optimized images are deleted.

This can be a convenient way to hide an album without deleting the underlying directory and files.

Note: When this option is selected, the album can be re-imported into the gallery by synchronizing a parent album with the recursive option selected.

You can permanently prevent a file or directory from being imported with one of these tricks:

  • Mark the file or directory as hidden with a file utility such as Windows Explorer
  • Edit the NTFS permissions on the IIS application pool identity so that it does not have access to the file or directory.

data.name: Task_Delete_Album_DeleteDbRecordsOnly_Lbl
data.value: Delete only the database records; keep the files/directories associated with this album

data.name: Task_Delete_Objects_DeleteDbRecordsOnly_Bdy
data.value:
When selected, the media files and directories associated with the selected objects are preserved; only the database records and the thumbnail/optimized images are deleted.

This can be a convenient way to hide an object without deleting the underlying directory or file.

Note: When this option is selected, the object can be re-imported into the gallery with the synchronize function.

You can permanently prevent a file or directory from being imported with one of these tricks:

  • Mark the file or directory as hidden with a file utility such as Windows Explorer
  • Edit the NTFS permissions on the IIS application pool identity so that it does not have access to the file or directory.

data.name: Task_Delete_Objects_DeleteDbRecordsOnly_Lbl
data.value: Delete only the database records; keep the files/directories

data.name: Admin_Metadata_MediaObjectCaptionTemplate_Label
data.value: Caption template for new media objects:

data.name: Cfg_mediaObjectCaptionTemplate_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies the template to use for the caption assigned to newly added media objects. Replacement tokens can be used to generate captions based on the media file\\'s properties. The list of available token values is shown below in the Metadata Display Options section.

The template can contain HTML.

Examples:

  • {Title}
  • {IptcHeadline}
  • Title: <b>{Title}</b>
  • {Title} <em>({FileSizeKb})</em>

If a media file does not contain metadata matching a specified token, the token is replaced with an empty string. If the template results in an empty caption, the file name is used for the caption.

This setting applies only when uploading media files or adding objects through a synchronization. It cannot be used to update the caption of existing media objects.

data.name: Admin_Metadata_Display_Settings_Label
data.value: Drag each item to the desired position. Use the checkbox to control whether the item is visible.

data.name: Cfg_metadataDisplaySettings_Bdy
data.value:
All media objects have properties that can be viewed in the metadata popup window. This window appears when a user selects the View metadata button in the toolbar that appears above media objects. You can control the visibility and order of these properties in this section.

Show or hide individual properties with the checkbox. Change the order by dragging the items in the list to the desired position.

If the option to view metadata above is turned off, all metadata is hidden from users, even if individual items in the list are enabled.

Note: This list represents the metadata items supported in Gallery Server Pro, but not all images and other media files contain all these properties. Only the properties that are found in the media file are displayed.

data.name: Cfg_jQueryScriptPath_Bdy
data.value:
The path to the jQuery script file. The path may be:

  • Relative to the root of the web application. Ex: "~/gs/script/jquery-1.4.4.min.js"
  • A full URL. Ex: "//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1/jquery.min.js"

If the web application already uses jQuery and is adding the jQuery script reference through another mechanism, specify a blank string for this setting.

data.name: Cfg_jQueryUIScriptPath_Bdy
data.value:
The path to the jQuery UI script file. The path may be:

  • Relative to the root of the web application. Ex: "~/gs/script/jquery-ui-1.8.9.custom.min.js"
  • A full URL. Ex: "//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jqueryui/1.8.9/jquery-ui.min.js"

If the web application already uses jQuery UI and is adding the script reference through another mechanism, specify a blank string for this setting.

data.name: Cfg_jQueryUIScriptPath_Hdr
data.value: Path to jQuery UI script file

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_InvalidJQueryPath
data.value: The specified jQuery path does not exist

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_FFmpeg_Info_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether ffmpeg.exe was discovered in the application\\'s bin directory. FFmpeg is an open source utility used to create thumbnail images from videos.

This utility is installed separately as part of the Gallery Server Pro Binary Pack, available for free from www.galleryserverpro.com.

Note: The application must be running in full trust to execute this utility.

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_ImageMagick_Info_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether convert.exe, which is a component of the ImageMagick utility, was discovered in the application\\'s bin directory. ImageMagick is an open source utility used to create thumbnail images from PDF and EPS files.

This utility is installed separately as part of the Gallery Server Pro Binary Pack, available for free from www.galleryserverpro.com.

Note: The application must be running in full trust to execute this utility.

Note: ImageMagick requires that GhostScript be installed. GhostScript is included in the Binary Pack.

data.name: Cfg_gpsMapUrlTemplate_Bdy
data.value:
When a media file contains a GPS location, the gallery can automatically create a URL to a mapping service. The URL is displayed in the metadata popup window.

This setting defines the template to use for constructing the hyperlink. By default, it uses Bing Maps, but you can use any service. For example, use the following template for Google Maps:

<a href=\\'http://maps.google.com/maps?q={GpsLatitude},{GpsLongitude}+({TitleNoHtml})\\' target=\\'_blank\\' title=\\'View map\\'>{GpsLocation}</a>

The following replacement tokens are supported:

{GpsLatitude}Ex: 47.145333
{GpsLongitude}Ex: 10.794000
{TitleNoHtml}
{MediaObjectPageUrl}
{MediaObjectUrl}
{GpsLocation}Ex: 47.145333° N 10.794000° E

This setting is used to by the metadata properties GpsLocationWithMapLink and GpsDestLocationWithMapLink. See the Metadata Display Options section below to control their visibility and position.

data.name: Installer_Upgrade_MigrateToSqlCe_Dtl1
data.value: Versions 2.5 and higher replace the SQLite database with Microsoft SQL Server CE. It offers all the advantages of SQLite, including a locally stored database file with no external dependencies, while adding new features.

data.name: Installer_Upgrade_MigrateToSqlCe_Dtl2
data.value: Note: This operation copies data from galleryserverpro_data.sqlite to GalleryServerPro_Data.sdf in the App_Data directory. When complete, you can delete the file galleryserverpro_data.sqlite.

data.name: Installer_Upgrade_MigrateToSqlCe_Dtl3
data.value: Click Next to migrate the data from SQLite to SQL CE.

data.name: Installer_Upgrade_WebConfig_Imported_Items2
data.value: If using SQLite, those references are updated to SQL CE.

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_DataProvider_Compact_Bdy
data.value:
Microsoft recommends periodically running this command to maintain the health and performance of your SQL CE database. In addition, it can repair some types of corruption. The following tasks are performed:

  • Indexes are recreated.
  • Tables are defragmented.
  • Identity column values are recalculated based on existing data.
  • If data corruption is found, a repair is automatically attempted.

data.name: UC_MediaObjectView_Media_Object_Being_Processed_Text
data.value:
The item is being processed.
You may be able to access the original media file in the toolbar.

data.name: Admin_VidAudOther_AddEncoder_CmdText
data.comment: 2011.XX.XX

data.name: Task_Add_Objects_OK_Btn_Text
data.comment: 2011.XX.XX

data.name: Admin_VidAudOther_EncoderSettings_InsufficientTrust_Msg
data.value: Not available. Requires full trust; application running at {0} trust.

data.name: Admin_VidAudOther_EncoderSettings_FFmpegMissing_Msg
data.value: Not available. FFmpeg.exe not found in bin directory. Install the Gallery Server Pro Binary Pack.

data.name: Admin_VidAudOther_EncoderSettings_Overview_Bdy
data.value:
You can create web-friendly versions of video and audio files when they are added to the gallery or during synchronization.

The settings in this section are used to match video and audio files based on the file extension, and then create an encoded version based on the provided arguments. The order is important, as the gallery applies the first match it finds. That means you want the All video and All audio selectors last. If an encoding fails, the next matching encoding is tried.

The arguments you specify are passed to FFmpeg and can contain any valid FFmpeg options. The following replacement tokens are supported: {SourceFilePath}, {DestinationFilePath}, {BinPath} (path to app\\'s bin directory), and {GalleryResourcesPath} (path to GSP\\'s resources directory).

To tell the encoder to skip a particular file type, enter an empty set of FFmpeg arguments.

The default encoder settings for video attempt to create a Flash Video (FLV) version. If that fails, an MP4 H.264 version is attempted. Audio files are encoded to M4A. MP3, M4A, MP4, and FLV files are not encoded since they are already web-friendly.

MP4 / H.264: This is a great codec for the web, but current versions of FFmpeg create a file that must be fully downloaded before playback begins. Despite this, you may prefer this codec because of its advantages (HTML5 support, smaller file size, iOS compatibility).

To force the encoder to run against existing media objects, perform a synchronization. Use the \\'Rebuild optimized versions\\' option to overwrite any existing encoded version.

The encoder requires the application to be running at full trust and the FFmpeg.exe utility exist in the application\\'s bin directory. FFmpeg can be found at ffmpeg.org or, for your convenience, in the Gallery Server Pro Binary Pack.

data.name: Admin_VidAudOther_EncoderTimeout_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies the timeout value for the encoder in milliseconds. If the encoder doesn\\'t complete in the specified amount of time, the encoding is aborted.

Specify the smallest amount of time necessary to handle your encoding needs. In cases where the encoder has hung and does not respond to cancel requests, the timeout is the only way to force an exit to kill any processor load it is putting on the web server.

The default value is 15 minutes (900,000 seconds).

data.name: Admin_VidAudOther_EncoderSettings_Tip
data.value: Tip: An empty argument means that file type should be ignored (NOT encoded).
